title: query-customer-payment-plan

View page on sitePage historySuggested Edits 0
This endpoint searches for all customers and their associated payment plans created under a business, based on the parameters passed in the request. All parameters are optional. 
Queries will not return canceled or deleted customer payment plans. 
 
## The request Query a customer payment plan by sending a **POST** API request to the URI below. ### Endpoint live <pre class="api-header-long-url"><p class="api-header"><span class="post-tag">POST</span>https://api2.checkout.com/v2/recurringPayments/customers/search</p></pre> ### Endpoint sandbox <pre class="api-header-long-url"><p class="api-header"><span class="post-tag">POST</span>https://sandbox.checkout.com/api2/v2/recurringPayments/customers/search</p></pre> ### Header parameters 
x    
Add Row Add Col
`Authorization` <span class="req-def">Required</span> 
`secret key`* 
`Content-Type` <span class="req-def">Required</span> 
`application/json` 
*For authorization, use the valid `secret key` of your Checkout.com account. You can find this in [The Hub](https://hub.checkout.com/). ### Request example 
Shell Java

20

### Additional parameters  
x    
Add Row Add Col
`fromDate ` <span class="field-type">Integer</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
Start date in UTC date and time (based on ISO 8601 profile). Format: `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ` (e.g., `2015-11-05T13:00:00Z` or `2015-11-05T08:00:00-05:00`). 
`toDate` <span class="field-type">Integer</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
End date in UTC date and time (based on ISO 8601 profile). Format: `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ` (e.g., `2015-11-05T13:00:00Z` or `2015-11-05T08:00:00-05:00`). 
`offset` <span class="field-type">Integer</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
A cursor used for paging. <span class="table-info">Default is 1. (eg:, if count=10 and offset=2, then records 11 to 20 returned)</span> 
`Count ` <span class="field-type">Integer</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
Number of records to return. <span class="table-info">Default is 10.</span> 
`autoCapTime ` <span class="field-type">Decimal</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
Set the delayed capture time in hours. Use values 0 to 168 (0 to 7 days). <span class="table-info">For more precise timings, use decimals: eg., 0.5 = 30 mins.</span> 
`cardId` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
A string of characters that uniquely identifies a card associated with a customer. For example, if two customers use the same card, a different card ID is generated for each customer. (prefixed with `card_`) 
`currency` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
Three-letter ISO currency code representing the currency of the payment. 
`customerId` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
An ID prefixed with `cust_` that uniquely identifies the customer 
`cycle ` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
The elapsed time between the charge and the first transaction of the recurring plan. Maximum characters: 4. **Usage format: ** * Xd (X: 1 - 730 days) e.g. 7d * Xw (X: 1 - 104 weeks) e.g. 2w * Xm (X: 1 - 24 months) e.g. 1m * Xy (X: 1 - 2 years) e.g. 1y 
`name` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
The name of the payment plan as displayed in The Hub and attached to the customer. Maximum characters: 100. 
`nextRecurringDate` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
Date of the next recurring transaction in "YYYY-MM-DD" format (e.g. '2015-01-20'). This is especially useful when the merchant has applied a double recurring plan. 
`planId` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
Payment plan ID prefixed with `rp_` for identical recurring plans. 
`planTrackId` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
Unique identifier for the recurring plan set by the Merchant. Maximum characters: 50. 
`status` <span class="field-type">Integer</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
Defines the status of the recurring payment plan. It is used for the endpoint that will allow monitoring of the health of a recurring plan. Possible returned values: * 0, "Failed Initial" : The transaction in the main charge request failed or was declined. * 1, "Active" : Active recurring payment plan, response if the transaction / payment plan is successful * 2, "Cancelled" : Cancelled (via API or the Hub) * 3, "In Arrears" : The recurring transactions failed. * 4, "Suspended" : Merchant paused the service. Or If retries also failed. * 5, "Completed" : Recurring payment plan completed. 
`startDate` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
Forecasted timestamp of the first transaction generated by the recurring plan in "YYYY-MM-DD" format. 
`value` <span class="field-type">Integer</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
he value of the payment as a non-zero positive integer (no decimals). <span class="table-info">[Find out more](doc:calculating-the-value)</span> 
--- ## The response Returns a paginated payment plan object if the request is successful. Returns an error if something goes wrong. If you're having problems with this API, then ask our [support team](mailto:support@checkout.com) for help. ### Response example Take a look at the example response below.

## Response parameters  
x    
Add Row Add Col
`count` <span class="field-type">Integer</span> 
Number of records to return back in response 
`data` <span class="field-type">Array</span> 
Array of payment plan objects 
`offset` <span class="field-type">Integer</span> 
Number of records to skip before adding results to the response. 
`totalRows` <span class="field-type">Integer</span> 
Total number of matching rows to return.
